Description.div: The AggregateSupplyOfNonRequestedTag flag indicates whether the system has aggregated the supplies that are returned by the API. If the flag is set to Y, supplies are aggregated irrespective of the tag information and displayed in the output XML. If the flag is set to N, supplies are returned in the output XML with the tag information.
Specifies the Allocation Rule Id used for obtaining possible schedules.
Indicates if inventory should to be checked while finding possible schedules.

The ConsiderSupplementalCapacity flag indicates that supplemental capacity should also be considered when computing the availability of the resource pools which can serve the service lines.
If ConsiderSupplementalCapacity flag is not passed as Y , then the value of the CanConsumeSupplementalCapacity attribute of the customer (if existed) in the order will be used.
Default: N
Valid Values: Y or N

Specifies the delay allowed for Product and Service lines. The number of days specified in the 'DelayWindow' is counted from today (the day on which the API is run). If this attribute is not passed, then Allowed_Shipment_Delay_Days and the Service_Search_Window (in case of DS lines) specified in Allocation rules will be considered for setting the Delay Window. If both these values are there (For an Order with Product and Delivery Assoc), then the Service_Search_Window for the DS line would be considered by the API.
Flag to ignore Minimum Notification time associated with Item and Shipnode.
If set to Y, check will be made only for product lines. Service lines will be ignored. If not passed, assumed N.

The IncludeAllOrderLines flag indicates that all order lines of the order should be included as required lines. System will only look at this flag when there is no order line information provided in the root element.
Default: N
Valid Values: Y or N

Flag to indicates whether inventory can be partially promised against substitute and partially against original item. On the order this flag will always be N.
Valid Values: Y or N

Positive integer used to determine the maximum number of possible solutions to find.
Default: 1
Specifies if the api was invoked in Inquire Mode or Schedule Mode.

This value determines the optimization rules to be applied to the scheduling process.
Default: 01
Number of days to look for inventory availability beyond requested date for scheduling Product lines.
Flag to indicate if Multiple Service Slots be returned by the api
Number of days to look for inventory availability beyond requested date for scheduling Service lines.

The UseUnplannedInventory flag indicates that system should assume that there is available unplanned inventory (inventory for which assumes to be available on current date + item's lead time) for any unavailable quantities. If the UseUnplannedInventory flag is passed, it will override the UseUnplannedInventory attribute on the item in the catalog. Otherwise, the UseUnplannedInventory attribute on the item will be used.
The AvailableFromUnplannedInventory flag indicates that one or more assignments of the option consumes from the unplanned inventory when the UseUnplannedInventory flag is set to Y .
First Date inventory is available
Flag to indicate if there is any unavailalbe product or service quantity.
Last Date when Inventory can be obtained
Indicates least priority across all product assignment's NodePriorities.
Indicates maximum priority across all product assignment's NodePriorities.
Specifies the Number of the option

Flag to indicates whether inventory is replaced with the Preferred Substitute.
Valid Values: Y or N
Flag to indicate if the order line can be scheduled.
Date and Time after which the order line cannot be scheduled.
Date and Time before which the order line cannot be scheduled.
Scac And Service Key
End Date for Delivery Search. Specifies the upper bound of the window in which delivery line is searched.
Start Date for Delivery Search. Specifies the lower bound of the window in which delivery line is searched.
Flag to indicate if the promise line is a bundle parent.
The ItemId of the preferred substitute that is used in place of the original item.
Required Quantity
Specifies the Order Line Schedule Key
Specifies the Schedule Number of the order line's schedule record.
End Date for Delivery Search. Specifies the upper bound of the window in which delivery line is searched.
Start Date for Delivery Search. Specifies the lower bound of the window in which delivery line is searched.
The Tag number that uniquely identifies the Inventory attributes of the Item.
Indicates that this line cannot be scheduled until a sequence line completes scheduling.

The AvailableFromUnplannedInventory flag indicates that the assignment consumes from the unplanned inventory when the UseUnplannedInventory flag is set to Y . In case of bundle parents, this indicates if any component assignment of this assignment has consumed unplanned inventory.
Delivery Date of the assignment
Distance between the Shipping Address and Node's address measured in MILES.
The earliest ship date available for the assignment.
Specifies the reason for empty assignment.
Flag to indicate if the node is an External Node
Number of the interaction
Node which will be used for forwarding.
Priority of the Node.
Product Quantity that can be procured from another node
Date on which the product will be avaliable at the suggested Ship Node.
Quantity that can be obtained for this assignemnt.
The amount of unplanned inventory used by the assignment. In case of bundle parents, this will be 0.00.
Indicates quantity already available for the line due to the line reservations or already scheduled quantity.
Carrier Code determined by routing.
Quantity for which segment has been changed.
Shipment Date
Node from which inventory is available
Quantity substituted for the original item.
The multistop transfer number used for this assignment.

Attribute.Name: ConsumedQuantity
Attribute.Description: The amount consumed for this assignment. If the ship node does not track inventory, then the AvailableQuantity is returned as 0.00.

Description.div: First date that item(s) can be shipped.
Last date that item(s) can be shipped.
Indicates wether the inventory is tracked or not. If inventory is not tracked, the flag is returned as N and ConsumedQuantity is returned as 0.
ItemID of the substitute Item
Product Quantity that can be procured from another node
Product class of the substitute Item
Quantity of the substitute Item
Indicates quantity already available for the line due to the line reservations or already scheduled quantity.
Unit Of Measure of the substitute Item

Attribute.Name: ConsumedQuantity
Attribute.Description: The amount consumed for this assignment. If the ship node does not track inventory, then the AvailableQuantity is returned as 0.00.

Description.div: First date that item(s) can be shipped.
Last date that item(s) can be shipped.
Indicates wether the inventory is tracked or not. If inventory is not tracked, the flag is returned as N and ConsumedQuantity is returned as 0.
Indicates whether ProcureFromNode requires transfer acceptance.
Indicates node from which product is being procured.
Date on which the product will be avaliable at the suggested Procurement Node.
Indicates quantity being procured.
Indicates quantity already available for the line due to the line reservations or already scheduled quantity.
Shipment Date from the procurement node.
The multistop transfer number used for this procurement.

Start Date for Delivery Search. Specifies the lower bound of the window in which delivery line is searched.

Indicates that this line cannot be scheduled until a sequence line completes scheduling.
The capacity required in the secondary capacity unit of measure.
The secondary capacity unit of measure, shown according to the item's configuration. If multiple item UOMs exist, all are converted to one UOM and displayed.
Time Zone of the service time slots
Time when the service slot selected ends
Description of the service slot
Time when the service slot selected starts
This field indicates the available capacity of the slot.
Flag to indicate if the capacity is available for the slot
Flag to indicate if the slot is confirmed or not
Date of the slot
Flag to indicate if the slot is a preferred slot of the customer.
Flag to indicate if the region is serviced for the slot
Flag to indicate if the capacity is available for the slot
Flag to indicate if the slot is confirmed or not
Flag to indicate if the region is serviced for the slot
The capacity requested in the additional capacity unit of measure.
The additional capacity unit of measure in which capacity is requested.
Date for which the Appointment can be taken
Date and Time when the appointment ends for Service Line
Date and Time when the appointment starts for Service Line
Time when the appointment Ends for Service Line
Flag to indicate if the node is an External Node
Number of the interaction
Priority of the Node
Specifies the Ship Node used for Provided or Delivery Service
Time when the appointment starts for Service Line
TimeZone of the Promised Appointments
Date and Time when the appointment ends for Service Line.
Date and Time when the appointment starts for Service Line.
Carrier used for obtaining possible schedules.
Carrier Service Code.
Delivery date of the interaction. If not optimizing on date, this is the earliest delivery date across assignments for this interaction. Otherwise, it is the latest.
DeliveryMethod used for obtaining the promise line. Posible values include Delivery DEL, Ship SHP or Pick Up PICK.
First Date inventory or capacity is available.
This number denotes the position in the sequence for the particular interaction.
Flag to indicate if the promise line is a Delivery Line.
Item Group Code of the Item present in line. Possible values are Product PROD, Delivery DS or Provided Service PS
Last Date when Inventory or capacity can be obtained.
The level of service to be used for this interaction.
Node from where the Service is being done.
Organization Code of the external inventory or capacity organization.
Flag to indicate if the promise line is schedulable.
Shipment date of the interaction. If not optimizing on date, this is the earliest shipment date across assignments for this interaction. Otherwise, it is the latest.

Interaction node gives details such as Date and Time when the product or service item is available. It provides information on whether the interaction with the customer involves a product item being delivered or if a service will be performed at the specified time.
Specifies if the ShipTo information is from history tables.
Specifies the Non-Working Date.
The total number of multistop transfers.
The date at which inventory will arrive at the DestinationNode.

Attribute.Name: DestinationNode
Attribute.Description: The final node where inventory will be arriving.

Attribute.Name: OriginNode
Attribute.Description: The initial node where inventory is being shipped from.

Description.div: The date in which inventory will leave the OriginNode.
The total number of stops for the multistop transfer.
The date in which inventory is to arrive at the node for this stop.
The node that the transfer will stop at.
The date in which inventory will leave the node for this stop.
This represents the stop number for the transfer at this node. This number will be in sequence of stops.
Assigned Quantity

The ItemId of the preferred substitute that is used in place of the original item.
Total scheduled Quantity to be released
Total Unscheduled Quantity to be scheduled

Attribute.Name: DistributionRuleId
Attribute.Description: Distribution rule ID to be used to determine the ship node(s) that will ship the order line.

Attribute.Name: ShipNode
Attribute.Description: ShipNode to be used for sourcing.
